intro: Eudianthe oculata, commonly known as the eye-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant features oval-shaped leaves with a distinctive, prominent vein pattern that resembles an eye, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. Eudianthe oculata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
